title: Organic No Till Farming For Home Gardeners and Commercial Farmers

tasks.task: No-till farming for organic farmers and home gardeners using light exclusion.
subtasks: Establish a cover crop. (e.g., planting five species such as cowpeas, forage radish, black mustard, oats, and buckwheat)
Use a roller to crush the cover crop or roll it down.
Apply durable polypropylene fabrics over the crushed cover crop. Secure the fabric edges with sandsacks or water-filled hoses.
Wait for one week to allow the cover crop to die from darkness and heat.
Remove the fabric and plant transplants, taking advantage of the decomposing cover crop nutrients.

tasks.task: Use plastic fabrics for weed control and pest management.
subtasks: Cover emerging weeds to prevent light and kill them.
Employ the same technique to control nematodes by baiting them with a susceptible crop and then removing the fabric before they reproduce.
